text: Shashi Shanker will be the next chairman and managing director of India's biggest oil and gas producer, ONGC.Government headhunter Public Enterprise Selection Board (PESB) selected Shanker to head Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. (ONGC) from October 1.Shanker is currently Director (Technical and Field Services), ONGC. He will replace Dinesh K Sarraf who retires on September 30 upon attaining superannuation age.PESB said it interviewed nine candidates including Oil India Director (HR) Biswajit Roy and ONGC Videsh Ltd Director (Finance) Vivekanand. His name will now be vetted by the ministry of petroleum and natural gas, and after obtaining clearance from anti-corruption watchdog CVC and CBI sent to the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet.His appointment will be finalised after ACC, headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, approves it.Shanker, 56, will have a nearly four-year term till March 2021.
title: Shashi Shanker To Take Over As ONGC Chairman From October 1
